original_title: Sri Lanka services grow in June, manufacturing hit by exports
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s services activities continued to grow in June helped by financial services and professional services, though manufacturing was hit by weak apparel exports, according a Purchasing Managers’ Index.
Financial services sub-sector showed improvements driven by the gradual decrease in market interest rates.

“In addition, other personal services, education and professional services sub-sectors also exhibited positive developments during the month,” as statement issued by the central bank which compiles the index said.
“Nevertheless, wholesale and retail trade sub-sector experienced a continued decline in business activities, though there was some improvement in clothing and footwear businesses due to Hajj season.”
“Production and New Orders declined, mainly driven by the manufacture of textile and apparel sector,” the statement said.
“As mentioned by many respondents, continued subdued global demand was the major reason for this decline.
“However, some improvement in New Orders and Production was observed in the manufacture of food and beverages sector with the reduction of prices by some manufacturers to increase the market demand.
“Employment and Stock of Purchases also decreased in line with the decline in New Orders and Production.
Respondents had said they tended to replace only the essential staff and also to maintain a minimum raw material stock. (Colombo/July18/2023)
